result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd L Justman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no contact with the victim or the victim's residence. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Transfer is authorized to a jail convenient to Defendant's employment or residence.

supervisions.notes: Time shall be served consecutive to Ct. 1 and with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: All condition of probation imposed in Ct. 1 shall remain the same as conditions of probation in Ct. 2.

records.addlTxt: Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Def in person & by Atty. Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty. Mandy A. Schepper and Atty. Peter Cannon appeared for State.  Reading of Information waived.  Resolution reached; State moves to amend the sole count of the Information to the following two misdemeanor counts:  Ct. 1 - Misd. Theft pursuant to sec. 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a) and Ct. 2 - Criminal Trespass to Dwelling pursuant to sec. 943.14 and Court so orders.  Defense free to argue as to condition time.  Guilty plea entered on amended Cts. 1 and 2.  Court finds def guilty on amended Cts. 1 and 2.  Argument by counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Brian Michael Borkowicz.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State. 1st appearance. Discovery and PT needed.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 09:45 am.
No contact with AM or residence; Maintain absolute sobriety; No controlled substance without valid prescription

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich for the State Public Defenders office.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.   State requests sig bond; Court sets $2500 sig bond.  SPD will represent.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and appearance w/ atty. Hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
